users

Class Manager

  • java.lang.Object
    • users.User
      • users.Manager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BorrowerConstants, java.io.Serializable

    public class Manager
extends User
implements BorrowerConstants, java.io.Serializable
    Manager class, a user who can manage the inventory and validate or refuse loans. He also controls the state of loans. initial code by: Marc Karassev; modified by: Marc Karassev, Anthony Saraïs
    Author:
    Marc Karassev, Anthony Saraïs
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface config.BorrowerConstants

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Manager()
      Default constructor, constructs a new Manager with an ID like "M-number" and an unknown name.
      Manager(java.lang.String n)
      Constructs a new Manager with an ID like "M-number" and a specified name.
      Manager(java.lang.String i, java.lang.String n)
      Constructs a new Manager with the specified ID and name.

    • Method Detail

      • addModel

        public void addModel(Model m)

        Parameters:

      • removeModel

        public void removeModel(Model m)
        Removes a model from the management system's set of models.
        Parameters:
        m - the model to remove

      • acceptAsk

        public void acceptAsk(Ask ask)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.lang.NullPointerException
        Accepts an ask and creates the corresponding loan. The ask is removed from the management system's ask list and the loan is added to its loan list.
        Parameters:
        ask - the ask to accept
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.NullPointerException - when there's not enough equipment available to create the loan

      • checkAsks

        public java.util.HashMap<Ask,java.lang.String> checkAsks()
        Checks automatically all the asks of the management system.
        Returns:
        an HashMap where keys are the asks and value a string describing the result of its validity checking.

      • checkAsk

        public java.lang.String checkAsk(Ask a)
        Checks an ask by successively checking all error possibilities.
        Parameters:
        a - the ask to check
        Returns:
        a string description of the result of the ask validity checking

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the manager and its values.
        Overrides:
        toString in class User
